message: Hi Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,200,000.  It's a fantastic opportunity for you, and I'm confident you'll find it very valuable. Let me know what you think!
I appreciate your confidence in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900,000. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to stay within my budget.

Bob, I understand you're trying to stay within your budget, and I'm happy to work with you.  I can come down to $1,050,000. This is a fair price considering the immense value you'll gain from this product. Let's make this happen!

I appreciate your willingness to work with me, but $1,050,000 is still above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm offering $950,000 for the product. This is my final offer, I'm not willing to go any higher.

Bob, I understand you're firm on your budget, and I appreciate your honesty. I'm willing to come down a bit further to $975,000. This shows my commitment to making this deal work, and I'm confident you'll find the product a valuable asset. Let's reach an agreement that benefits us both.

I appreciate your willingness to come down to $975,000, but I'm still not there. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $975,000 and my original offer of $900,000, so I'm offering $937,500 for the product. This is my next best offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I understand your position, but I need to stay above $950,000 to make this deal work for me.  I'm willing to come down to $962,500. This is a fair compromise that recognizes the value of the product while respecting your budget. We're so close to an agreement; let's get this done!

I understand that you need to make this deal work for you, but I'm not willing to go above $950,000. I'm willing to make a serious commitment to buy the product, but I need to stay within my budget. I'm sticking to my previous offer of $950,000 for the product.
